Posts.Content: tsherner wrote: Hi all, I am seeking wisdom from all of you and hopefully some hopeful words...  You can see below what my BC is and what has happened.  I had a Bilat. mastectomy in Sept 07, followed by 6 treatments A/C and 6 treatments Taxol, dose dense, every two weeks.  No radiation.  I have been taking Tamoxifen for about 10 months now.  I had a silicone implant reconstruction, expanders done in July 08, then implants placed in Dec 1, 08.  My problem, I have been having rib pain, only one side, (my affected side).  The pain is constant, sometimes sharp like a knife, sometimes just a dull ache.  It has been going on for about 4 months.  At first I just attributed it to the discomfort of the expanders, then the placement of the implants..., but the pain is deeper than that, and it is only one side.  So.... I have an appt with the oncologist on Tues. but as usual the waiting is horrible.  The other thing I have is a kind of "surety" that this is a recurrence.  Seems my intuition is telling me the worst So, my questions are:  what were your symptoms of recurrence if any?  And did you have a sense or intuition that it was back before the diagnosis happened? Thanks for any words of wisdom. Tammie Dx 8/27/2007, ILC, 5cm, Stage IIIB, Grade 3, 6/11 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: symptoms of recurrence? tsherner Bugs

Posts.Content: tsherner wrote: Hi all, Just wanted to see if there was anyone else out there like me.  I was diagnosed in Sept of 2007, following a routine mammogram.  Had a bilateral mastectomy (modified radical with 2/11 nodes positive on the left side) and simple prophylactic on the right side.  They found two tumors, one IDC 3 cm, one ILC 2.5 cm. Tumors were positive, positive, negative.  The surgeon stated that mixed type is relatively rare... she had not seen it before.  I had 5 treatments of AC, 5 treatments of Taxol, finishing in Feb of 2008.  No radiation.  Had expanders placed in July of 2008, currently anxiously waiting the exchange to silicone implants on Dec 1.   I am 45, happily married to an orthopedic surgeon, have 2 children ages 6 and 10.  Needless to say, my world has been rocked in the last year.  I am interested in talking to anyone who also has mixed type breast cancer.  Is the chance of recurrence higher?  My oncologist assures me that we have this beat.  Just want some more reassurance.  Thanks for listening, Tammie  Dx 8/27/2007, ILC, 5cm, Stage IIIB, Grade 3, 6/11 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: mixed type Stage III breast cancer, anyone else? tsherner Naomi
